habitat_description:
Conant and Collins 1998, P. triseriata feriarum described to range from north New Jersey to the Florida panhandle, then west to east Texas into southeast Oklahoma. Isolated population occur in coastal South Carolina and southeast Georgia. In other words, this species is found in southeastern USA from Pennsylvania and New Jersey to Texas and western Florida (Conant and Collins 1991).

Habitat includes river-bottom swamps, grassy swales, moist woodlands, and environs of marshes, bogs, and ponds. Considered a north dwelling upland frog, but that also inhabits lowlands in the south (Conant and Collins 1998).
